body:
I'm using gRPC in production, and I've made react-native binding for gRPC. To implement some features like hostnameOverride, we have to modify some code in gRPC-Objc.
I don't think the gRPC-Objc is production ready.

## GRPCChannel
The GRPCChannel and GRPCHost are private. I think it would be better if we can create a GRPCChannel like grpc-java, with ability to manage state of the channel and customize the channel arguments.
### Channel arguments
I found some hardcoded channel args and have no way to change externally, See https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/ed64818520f2b4b8d47ce14abbd656505a2b6ef1/src/objective-c/GRPCClient/private/GRPCHost.m#L238.

If we wanna to create an insecure connection, we have to import `GRPCCall+Tests.h` and call `[GRPCCall useInsecureConnectionsForHost:host]` before we make the call. To revert that, we need to call `[GRPCCall resetHostSettings]`, and it will reset all host settings and close all connections.

Also, there is no way to set timeout and hostnameOverride, see https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/9555.
### Manage state of channel
There is no way to shutdown specify channel. If we want to shutdown a channel, we must shutdown all channels:
```
// internally called [GRPCHost flushChannelCache] to disconnect all connections.
[GRPCCall closeOpenConnections];
```
## GRPCCall
### Call options
The deadline hard coded to infinity in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/46357c882df1afc28f7a5228c40fde522093fa32/src/objective-c/GRPCClient/private/GRPCChannel.m#L200. We need an external timer to cancel the call.
### Misc
I think it would be better add more callback like onHeaders.

@rikuayanokozy I'm using gRPC in production too. I think that the TCP connections that remain open will cause me problem of scalability.
Did you implement a temporary solution in your production app?
